text: Wiscasset Mill...My grandfather, Fritz Luther, was an Albemarle High grad and I think he was friends with the family who owned your paper back in the day
author: RaleighReporter

text: Signs I'm getting old: Spending my Friday night researching my great-grandparents' history as Stanly County textile mill workers. I may have ended up on Ancestry dot com. Send help ...
author: RaleighReporter

text: “I hate using metaphor, but we’re taking a bazooka to an ant in trying to solve our assessments," Rep. Jeffrey Elmore said of current school testing: https://www.newsobserver.com/news/politics-government/article228277809.html … #ncpol #ncga #nced

text: Congrats to all my @newsobserver @TheHerald_Sun  colleagues on the N.C. Press Association awards last night! Also fun to have our first wins entering the contest under the @ncinsider banner:

text: NC Press Association gives Rep. Mitchell Setzer a 1st Amendment award...Says #ncga press corps "deserves combat pay". Maybe he can help us get out of the basement... #ncpol

text: Lots of controversy this week at the #ncga over who should be on the UNC Board of Governors https://www.newsobserver.com/news/politics-government/article228249204.html … #ncpol
author: RaleighReporter

text: Or is the N.C. State of this bracket @DallasWoodhouse, who lobbied for himself to win last year?
author: RaleighReporter

text: All Republicans cast ballots for the winning slate, while most Democrats' ballots were not counted because they did not select six candidates (per rules adopted unanimously for the process) #ncpol #ncga
author: RaleighReporter

text:
#ncga Senate has elected to the UNC Board of Governors: Darrell Allison, Thom Goolsby, Martin Holton, Anna Spangler Nelson, Temple Sloan and Michael Williford. All but Holton are current BOG members.

The one candidate who didn't get elected was Kaye Bernard McGarry #ncpol #ncga
author: RaleighReporter

text: #ncga Senate about to vote on UNC Board of Governors nominees. Democrats voicing concerns about process, diversity of candidates -- but none made any nominations during the process. Sen. Rabon says all nominated candidates are on the ballot. #ncpol
author: RaleighReporter

text: Drugging someone's drink would be illegal under this #ncga bill -- even if the act doesn't result in a sexual assault: https://www.newsobserver.com/news/politics-government/article228183734.html … #ncpol

text: .@NCHouseSpeaker declined (through a spokesman) to speak with reporters after today's session. We'd hoped to get his response to some of the criticism from Democrats of the UNC board appointments #ncpol #ncga

text: .@NCHouseSpeaker: No votes in the House tomorrow, Monday or Tuesday #ncpol #ncga
author: RaleighReporter

text: House nominations to UNC Board of Governors approved in 63-52 along what appear to be party lines. #ncpol #ncga #nced
author: RaleighReporter

text: So far, this debate has been dominated by Democrats objecting to the process. No speeches at this point from Republicans touting the merits of their UNC board nominees
author: RaleighReporter

text: Asked about the exclusion of current UNC BOG member Walter Davenport, Rep. @kellyhastings1 says Democrats did not suggest any nominees. "I think it would be probably wise for me not to mention anyone’s personal issues at this point." #ncpol #ncga
author: RaleighReporter

text: Rep. @GoNCRichardson says Democrats haven't had any input on board candidates and required ethics forms for the candidates has not been made available to review conflicts of interest #ncpol #ncga
author: RaleighReporter

text: #ncga House Democrats objecting to up-or-down vote on UNC Board of Governors appointments rather than electing by ballot, as Senate will do. Proposed slate removes incumbent black Democrat from board, replaces with white Republican #ncpol #ncga #nced
author: RaleighReporter

text: This is notable because there is no Democratic, Libertarian, Green or Constitution primary -- only contested primary is for the Republican nomination
author: RaleighReporter

text: Official word from @NCSBE is unaffiliated voters in #NC09 primary aren't locked into the party primary ballot they voted last year -- so unaffiliateds who voted in the Dems' 2018 primary have the option of GOP ballot this May (CC: @andyinrok, @EveryVoiceNC, @BrentWoodcox) #ncpol
author: RaleighReporter

text: Endorsements could have more of an impact on an #NC03 primary with so many Republicans. Also today, @jeffmoorenc is touting an endorsement from @RandPaul #ncpol
author: RaleighReporter

text: I think this is the one: https://www.ncleg.gov/BillLookUp/2019/H377 …

text: Not every day a politician basically says "you got me, I lied" #ncpol
author: RaleighReporter

text: Editing pet peeve: If you're writing for a news website where your article will be available to readers for weeks and months, stop using terms like "today" and "this week"
author: RaleighReporter

text:

text: I've never traced super far up the line but my Moravian connection is the Alspaugh family, which includes someone who served in the #ncga about a century ago

text: Very embarrassed that @LaurenHorsch asked me to guess the honoree of an official state cookie bill, and I -- despite being a descendant of Moravians -- did not guess that this was the right choice for NC #ncpol #ncga
author: RaleighReporter

text: By contrast, @NC_Governor's budget proposal was a $25.2 billion total, or a 5.4 percent growth from the prior year #ncpol #ncga

text:
Funny how whenever politicos of any stripe get called out for falsehoods, they like to bash the entire fact-checking concept.

But when the fact check vindicates them, they're quick to promote that "true" rating.

Keep up the great work, @PolitiFact !
author: RaleighReporter

text: Let me know if I missed any other NC #SunshineWeek stories ...

text: Lots of questions to @NC_Governor's administration went unanswered, including whether Cooper and family still have business ties to the solar company that sought his intervention with Duke Energy: https://www.newsobserver.com/news/politics-government/article227931954.html … #ncpol #ncga #SunshineWeek
author: RaleighReporter

text: My theory on this: If there's no competitive Democratic primary, left-leaning unaffiliated voters may opt to cast ballots in the GOP #NC09 primary. They might go for Anglin, making it harder for the leading Republican to avoid a run-off. Runoff = head start for McCready #ncpol
author: RaleighReporter

text: Kinda surprised we haven't seen a fake Democrat jump into #NC09 to give McCready a primary, but I guess there are still two hours to go in the filing period.
author: RaleighReporter
